jgame

Class GButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • jgame.GObject
      • jgame.GButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GAnimatable, GObjectHolder, GPaintable

    public class GButton
extends GObject
implements GAnimatable
    A simple button that uses GSprites, animated or static, for each button state defined in ButtonListener.State.
    Author:
    William Chargin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ButtonState currentState
      The current state of the button.
      private ButtonListener listener
      The ButtonListener used by this button.
      private java.util.Map<ButtonState,GSprite> sprites
      The map of sprites for the various button states.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GButton()
      Creates the button with the default settings and no images.

      • getSpriteForState

        private GSprite getSpriteForState(ButtonState buttonState)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the button sprite for the specified state. If no sprite for the state is set, the next most general state will be tried. For example, if the sprite for ButtonState.HOVERED is requested but none has been set, the sprite for ButtonState.NONE will be returned.
        Parameters:
        buttonState - the state to check
        Returns:
        the closest matching sprite
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if state is null

      • getValidButtonMask

        public int getValidButtonMask()
        Delegate method for ButtonListener.getValidButtonMask().
        Returns:
        the valid button mask

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Description copied from interface: GAnimatable
        Determines whether or not the animation is currently playing. The default value is true.
        Specified by:
        isPlaying in interface GAnimatable
        Returns:
        true if the animation is playing, or false if it is not

      • nextFrame

        public void nextFrame()
        Description copied from interface: GAnimatable
        Advances this object to the next frame.

        If the animation is already on the last frame, it will loop from the first frame.

        If the animation contains no frames, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        If the animation is not playing, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        nextFrame in interface GAnimatable

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Description copied from class: GObject
        Paints this object. The default GObject implementation does nothing but paint subcomponents.
        Specified by:
        paint in interface GPaintable
        Overrides:
        paint in class GObject
        Parameters:

      • previousFrame

        public void previousFrame()
        Description copied from interface: GAnimatable
        Takes this object to the previous frame.

        If the animation is already on the first frame, it will loop from the last frame.

        If the animation contains no frames, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        If the animation is not playing, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        previousFrame in interface GAnimatable
